text: Stephen Leo Bing (March 31, 1965 â€“ June 22, 2020) was an American businessman, movie producer, screenwriter and political donor to progressive causes. He was the founder of Shangri-La Entertainment. He also produced many Hollywood movies such as The Polar Express, Kangaroo Jack, Shine A Light and Rules Don't Apply. Bing committed suicide on June 22, 2020 by jumping off his apartment building in Los Angeles, aged 55. ==References== Category:1965 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Suicides Category:American progressives Category:Real estate developers Category:Movie producers from Los Angeles Category:Businesspeople from Los Angeles Category:Screenwriters from Los Angeles
title: Steve Bing
